required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: New Formulation Study of Inupadenant (EOS100850) in Patients With Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-Label, Phase I Clinical Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Food-Effect of Inupadenant New Formulation in Participants With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: A Multicenter, Open-Label, Phase I Clinical Study to assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Food-Effect of Inupadenant New Formulation in Participants with Advanced Solid Tumors

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Arm A sequential dose escalation Arm B randomized crossover

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) in patients with advanced solid tumors receiving inupadenant
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the DLT evaluation period that is cycle 1 (each cycle is 4 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events (AEs), serious adverse events (SAEs), DLTs, AEs leading to discontinuation, deaths, electrocardiogram (ECG) abnormalities, and clinically significant laboratory abnormalities

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of AEs in patients receiving inupadenant
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 months
primary_outcome.description: To assess safety and tolerability as measured by incidence and severity of AEs

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of inupadenant vs. time profiles
secondary_outcome.description: Determined by inspection of the concentration-time profile
Determined by inspection of the concentration-time profile
Determined by inspection of the concentration-time profile

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve in 1 dosing interval [AUC(TAU)]
secondary_outcome.description: Determined by inspection of the concentration-time profile
Determined by inspection of the concentration-time profile

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) v1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of preliminary efficacy of inupadenant

arm_group.description: Part 1A will evaluate the safety as well as to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and the recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D) of inupadenant in participants with advanced solid tumors.
The effect of food on the exposure to inupadenant will be investigated.

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding participation in the Trial, please refer to your physician
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women and men â‰¥18 years of age with Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1
- Subject with histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced solid tumor for whom no standard treatment is further available.
- At least 4 weeks since any previous treatment for cancer
- Subject must consent to pretreatment and on treatment tumor biopsies
- Adequate organ and marrow function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with primary brain tumors or primary tumors with central nervous system metastases as only location of disease. Controlled brain metastases are permitted
- Participants with second/other active cancers requiring current treatment
- Uncontrolled/significant heart disease
- Known History of chronic hepatitis, Positive test for Hepatitis B virus surface antigen or - - Hepatitis C antibody (except participants with liver cancer) or Human Immunodeficiency Virus/Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome(HIV/AIDS)
- Active/uncontrolled autoimmune disease
- Active infection Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply
